Name: Space Dinos
Description:
Boldly going where no Dinos had gone before...

During their mission to explore strange new worlds, the Space 
Dinos found a new home after the fall of their kind on earth. They continued their pursuit of exploration, tracking Stardust and building constellations that grace the night sky.  Space has become their final adventure. Join them in their continuing voyage to build constellations as they explore through space.

Earn the most star points while placing constellation tiles in the galaxy.  Constellation tiles may not be placed directly next to tiles of similar design (color or number of stars).

Constellations are available in 6 colors with 1 of each tile containing 1-6 stars.  Tiles must be placed making a grid that is 6x6 tiles. Dinos exploring constellations and creating pleasing constellation sets earn star points allowing them to travel through the galaxy.  Several game play missions are available and dictate new player objectives and are detailed in those missions.

—description from the designer

Name: Wanderlust: Travel Card Game
Description:
Do you love to travel? Do you like planning your vacations? Or you enjoy relaxing getaways. Wanderlust is a card game for everyone. Get a taste of travelling to different countries, explore what each place has to offer and make friends. Win rewards for exploring, planning or simply being the most fun person.

The Wanderlust card game starts like all card games – cards are shuffled and distributed between all the players. The rules mention different numbers of cards which are to be distributed to the players if different numbers of players are playing.

After the cards are distributed — the main objective of the game, making sets starts guiding the players. The unique thing about Wanderlust is the close connect between the story and the game mechanism. Sets need to made — but why, which and most importantly how?

The game has four type of cards. Destination cards, Currency cards, Journey cards and Reward cards. Each of the sets (Explorer, Planner and Fun Person) has a certain sequence of cards specified. This sequence is a mix of Destination and Currency cards or only one of these two kinds of cards.

In the game players collect Currency cards and trade Journey cards to get different Destination and Currency cards. This way different kinds of sets are made and Reward cards are won. The number of sets to be made is finite. The game is over when the Reward cards are over or if the game play gets stuck.

It contains 52 high quality cards and 1 easy-to-understand manual.

-description from designer

Name: Quem Vai?
Description:
Find who will go in this fast and fun game.

Quem Vai? (Portuguese for "Who go") is an accessory game that will help you make the most important decisions of your life!

Know that super nice game that you will play in 2 minutes? Who will be the first player? Use Quem Vai? to decide this and other things:

Who will order the pizza?
Who will do the dishes?
Who will get the last piece of cake?
Who will make popcorn?

Quem Vai? is fast and simple: simply shuffle the cards, pull one of them and done: you already have a criteria as to use to make the decisions about who will do something.

The game is quick and fits for two up to whoever many players are deciding.

Use Quem Vai? to decide the most important things in your life.

Name: Cuddly Cockroaches
Description:
Cuddly Cockroaches is a player elimination tabletop card game, inspired by the game maker’s real-life cockroach infestation that happened during the quarantine of Spring of 2020.

In Cuddly Cockroaches, players are neighbors in an apartment building with a Cockroach problem. Every turn starts with more cockroaches getting added to the game. Some cockroaches have special abilities that make them more desirable roommates - but they are also worth more points. The goal is to be the last apartment standing with less than ten roach points.

During a turn, players can use their cockroaches to infest their neighbors' apartments or play supply cards like bug spray or Exterminator to kill their roaches and send them to the basement. If a player has more than ten roach points at the end of their turn, they’ve lost the game! Losers turn over the apartment mat to reveal they’ve been fumigated, and their roaches scurry off to remaining apartments. The last apartment standing wins!

Infesting is the central mechanic in Cuddly Cockroaches. To infest, players pick a target neighbor, select any number of roaches from their apartment to infest with, and roll a die. To successfully infest, the dice roll has to be higher than the total value of roach points they’re infesting with. If successful, those roaches get sent to the target neighbor’s apartment. Roll equal or lower than the point value of roaches chosen for an infestation, and those roaches stay in the player’s apartment. Either way, the player attempting the infestation gets to draw a supply card.

Infesting challenges players to gauge their odds as they gamble to get rid of roaches. Bet conservatively, and risk the chance of getting fumigated before your neighbors over time. Take too much of a gamble, and risk never getting rid of your roaches. Supply cards can pass roaches from your apartment to your neighbors, add points to your dice roll or actions to your turn, or kill roaches and send them to the basement. But the only way to draw supply cards is by infesting, so players are rewarded for playing aggressively. Players get two actions per turn, any combo of infesting, playing a supply card, and shuffling their hand into the deck, and drawing three. Just like a real-life roach infestation, it’s a losing battle of bugs - but a lucky roll can be a game-changer!

Be a good neighbor, and share your roaches!

-description from publisher

Name: Pop-A-Plane
Description:
Pop-A-Plane is a promotional Australian board game produced by Maize Products Pty Ltd during the Second World War.
The object of the game is for players to shoot down opposing aircraft. To achieve this a player aims a movable metal field gun at a numbered plane and calls the numbered plane. Then the player rolls the dice. If the number on the dice matches the number on the selected plane then the plane is shot down. If there is no match the other player takes their turn.
The winner is the player who shoots down all the opposing enemy aircraft.

—user summary

Name: Mental Morris
Description:
Mental Morris is a two player abstract played entirely in the mind. It is however played on a mental board of 3x3 squares with three pieces each. The object is the game is to form a straight line of your pieces, either diagonally or orthogonally. If a player makes an illegal move, the opponent wins.

The board is numbered from top to bottom like a num pad. 1,2,3 on top, 4,5,6 on the next row and 7,8,9 on the final row.

Players initially place their three pieces on free squares by calling out the number of the square where they want their piece to be. After that players call out moves by naming the square of the piece they want to move, and then the square they want their piece to move to. Say it as one number, i.e. "fifty eight", (58). Pieces may move only one space in an orthogonal direction. Pieces may not share a square, and jumping over pieces is not allowed.

—description from the designer

Name: Astro Antics
Description:
Astro Antics is a space race board game produced in 1961. The game is a simple roll and move of pieces that resemble Mercury capsules of the era. 
The object of the game is to be the first to make one full orbit of the earth and return safely. A player can get trapped into a circular path around a spiral Nebula which will delay their progress. Two sets of cards "Orbit Chances" and "Emergency Instructions" are in the game and players must obey the directions if instructed to do so. Some of the instructions like make an ugly face or sing a song are supposed to add fun to the game.

—user summary

Name: Dingo Disc
Description:
A game of skill, balance, strategy and skill where players must place all their counters on a balanced disk without dropping the counters which have already been placed.

Each player, in turn, rolls both dice. The colour die determines the coloured area of the disk; the 6 die indicates the location to place the counter.

The winner is the player who places all his counters first. Any player who spills all the counters off the disk automatically loses.

Name: Wings of War WWI: RAF R.E.8
Description:
The RAF R.E.8, introduced in early 1917, was the long–awaited replacement for the Be2 series of recon airplanes, offering greater speed and strength. Initial reactions were mixed, as the R.E.8 required more pilot attention than the Be2 and early accidents of spinning and stalls resulted. Once overcome, the airplane became the standard for British observation and light bombing, serving through the end of the war. It was nicknamed “Harry Tate,” after a cockney comedian, who pronounced his name “AIR–EE.”

—description from the publisher

Name: Welcome to La Petite Mort
Description:
A Deadly Crossover!

Welcome to La Petite Mort is a unique crossover expansion that works both for Welcome to... and La Petite Mort - le Jeu.

Set in the dark humour universe of the French comic book "La Petite Mort" by Davy Mourier, players will act as the Reaper's son, who has been ordered to wipe the population of your neighborhood.

This expansion can be played with both games independently (you do not need to own both) with the same components.

Played with Welcome to..., this expansion asks the players to reap the souls of the inhabitants using a particular type of death (drowning in pools, car crash in parks,...) corresponding to the different actions of the game. Faster paced than the original and more streamlined, the expansion changes substantially the original gameplay.

Played with La Petite Mort, this expansion asks the players to reach new objectives for their Diploma as the Grim Reaper.They will have to make sure old people are "collected" and avoid the new and young residents, much harder to collect. Adding a new "write" mechanism to the original game, the expansion drastically changes the way the cards are played.

—description from the publisher

Name: Men in Tanks: Lazarus' War
Description:
Unleash the warlord within!
Greetings, fellow gamers! Get ready to embark on an adrenaline-fueled journey with Men in Tanks - Lazarus’ war, the ultimate modular, action-packed, arcade battle game that bridges the gap between family fun and hardcore gaming. This is not just a game; it's an epic battle for power, featuring a unique blend of strategy, chance, and heart-pounding action.

A battle for Empire's throne
Immerse yourself in the world of Men in Tanks, where Lazarus Croft, the dictator of Arcadia, orchestrates a high-stakes battle between four generals to determine the rightful heir to the empire's throne. The battleground at Cloverfield adds an extra layer of strategy with its varied landscapes. Customize the terrain, from rocks to bridges, and witness dynamic destruction and construction, intensifying the tactical depth of your battles.

Easy to learn, endlessly entertaining
Whether you're a seasoned strategist or a casual gamer, Men in Tanks promises an experience like no other. The modular battlefield and variable units ensure every game is a fresh adventure, keeping you on the edge of your seat. From dramatic comebacks to intense thrill and unexpected drama, this game packs it all.

Missions

     Deathmatch: Eliminate foes or collect medals in a relentless battle for dominance.
     Capture the Flag: Secure victory by bringing home the flag or collecting precious medals.


Formations

     Free for All: Embrace chaos! It's every tank for itself - survive and conquer.
     Team Battle: Forge alliances, strategize, and conquer as a united front.


Action modes

     Dice Mode: Leave it to chance with a unique dice featuring extra gold opportunities.
     Card Mode: Craft a consistent strategy with action cards that shape your gameplay.


Double the battle, double the fun!
With Men in Tanks' groundbreaking modularity, you can assemble two copies for a colossal battlefield, accommodating up to 8 players. Challenge your friends to the ultimate showdown and assert dominance over Cloverfield.

Navigate the battlefield like a pro
Understand the nuances of movement, skills, and actions with player aid cards. Master the art of warfare as you strategize with soldiers, vehicles, and crew members. Join us in this immersive world of strategy, chance, and conquest. Unleash the warlord within and dominate the battlefield! Prepare to dive into the most exciting strategic gameplay ever - Men in Tanks© awaits your command!

Name: Best 11 Board Game: Juventus
Description:
The first official Juventus football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Il primo gioco in scatola tutto calcistico ufficiale della Juventus! 
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.
Families: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni

Name: Monopoly: Juventus
Description:
The most famous board game in the world is enriched with this edition dedicated to the famous Juve team of Turin. 
Build your empire and amass fortunes, but beware of taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Juventus – Bite Size
Description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit. 
600 questions about the world of Juventus Football Club. 
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty! 
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box. 
Test your knowledge of the following topics: 

     Coaches,
     League,
     Curiosities,
     Players,
     International Matches,
     Victories. 


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit. 
600 domande sul mondo della Juventus Football Club. 
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti! 
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare. 
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti: 

     Allenatori,
     Campionato,
     Curiosità ,
     Giocatori,
     Partite Internazionali,
     Vittorie.

Name: Monopoly: Athletic Club Bilbao
Description:
Monopoly Rojiblanco - Athletic Club Bilbao
Lezama (Training HQ), San Mamés (stadium), the titles ... everything has its price.

Una edición exclusiva de Monopoly que incluye características diferenciadoras de las versiones normales del juego, como las casillas, que en vez de calles son momentos históricos y lugares emblemáticos del equipo rojiblanco como San Mamés, Lezama, la primera Liga, el equipo femenino, etc. Asímismo, las casas y hoteles se convierten ahora en gradas y estadios.

Las casillas 'Paseo del Prado' y 'Paseo de la Castellana', las más caras en la versión tradicional son aquí el escudo actual (400M) y la bandera (350M), las más baratas, justamente, el primer emblema e imagen del club rojiblanco.

Name: Best 11 Board Game: Inter
Description:
BEST 11 is an official F.C.Internazionale product: an exciting board game during which the participants will have to try to put their very personal Inter line-up into play by choosing the most suitable module and coach, complete the San Siro stadium, recover the economic resources necessary for the management of the company , take advantage of the events in their favor and challenge each other in search of a goal that could change the fate of the game.


BEST 11 è un prodotto ufficiale F.C. Internazionale: un board game avvincente durante il quale i partecipanti dovranno cercare di mettere in gioco una loro personalissima formazione dell’Inter scegliendo il modulo e l’allenatore più adatto, completare lo stadio di San Siro, recuperare le risorse economiche necessarie alla gestione della società, sfruttare gli avvenimenti a proprio favore e sfidarsi alla ricerca di un gol che potrebbe cambiare le sorti della partita.
Families: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni

Name: The Polka-Dot Game
Description:
The game is played on an 8x8 checkerboard of white and light grey squares.

Pieces consist of Dots in 8 colors - Pink, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Indigo, Turquoise, and Purple. There are 8 Dots for each color, for a total of 64 pieces.

The two players divide up the Dots however they like so that one player has all of 4 colors, and the other player has all of the of the other 4 colors.

Players take turns placing a Dot on any empty space on the board - with the following restriction: a Dot may not be placed on any square that shares the same row, column, or diagonal of a Dot of the same color.

First player unable to place a Dot on their turn loses.

-description from designer

Name: Everbane
Description:
Everbane is a role playing card game for 2 to 6 players where each player takes on the role of an epic hero in a cold and unforgiving world . Each hero is battling to be the most notorious hero in the land. Accomplish the most dangerous quests and be the first to get 10 prestige points to win the game. Trick your opponents, steal their loot, duel them & send monster on them. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversary.

ACCOMPLISH EPIC QUESTS

Draw a card from the quest pile and reveal it to the other players. Compete with other heroes to be the first to finish the quest. Each accomplished quest will give you prestige points. Be the first to get 10 and become Everbane’s most notorious hero !

TREACHERY & CUNNING

Duel your opponents, steal their card, unleash monsters against them and force them to trade their cards with you. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversaries.

—description from the designer

Name: Commotion
Description:
"The Fun, Fast, and Frantic Word Game!"

Players draw a card to determine a random secret.  They give give a one-word clues to help other players guess the secret word.  If someone does, the guesser and clue giver both score points.  When someone reaches 9 points, there is a showdown where that player has a chance to win the game.

The original game was released in 1990.  In 2020, a limited number of copies were re-released as the 30th Anniversary Edition, apparently using components discovered in storage from the original game.  All copies of the new edition are signed by Edward Carter.

Name: Monopoly: Inter
Description:
The most famous board game in the world is enriched with this edition dedicated to the famous Internazionale team of Milan. 
Build your empire and amass fortunes, but beware of taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Inter – Bite Size
Description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit. 
600 questions about the world of Inter Milan Football Club. 
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty! 
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box. 
Test your knowledge of the following topics: 

     Coaches,
     League,
     Curiosities,
     Players,
     International Matches,
     Victories. 


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit. 
600 domande sul mondo del Inter Milano Football Club. 
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti! 
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare. 
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti: 

     Allenatori,
     Campionato,
     Curiosità ,
     Giocatori,
     Partite Internazionali,
     Vittorie.

Name: Cohorts & Cronies
Description:
Cohorts & Cronies is a chaotic 2-4 player death match. Players assume the role of a Champion and build strategies to destroy one another on an ever-changing battlefield, using Champion-specific abilities and attacks, spells, traps, walls, towers, and of course, Cohorts & Cronies!

Players choose a random battlefield, gather resources, and fight to the bittersweet end. Use cards to call forth armies from different worlds, cast a dazzling array of magicks, and build all manner of defenses (warning: some defenses may be offensive). Finish your turn by uniting with your Cohorts & Cronies to launch devastating strikes against your opponents!

Throughout the battle, players will draw cards from the Event Deck in addition to their Champion's deck. The Event Deck is filled with Monsters, Gear, Merchants, Hazards, drastic Weather changes and Dimension Rifts to keep the chaos flowing. Within this deck also lurks the dreaded BOSS, smashing into the fray to attempt to kill all Champions. Nobody can win if the BOSS is alive.

This is an intricate, chaotic strategy game made for teens and adults with a love for complex mechanics, inappropriate jokes, and roguelike replayability. There are no duplicate cards; choose wisely!

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Borussia Mönchengladbach
Description:
Trivial Pursuit, Borussia Mönchengladbach Edition

     A game board, 100 cards with questions and answers
     1 die, 6 knowledge stores and 36 colored knowledge corners
     600 questions about Borussia Mönchengladbach


Trivial Pursuit in der Borussia Mönchengladbach Edition

     Ein Spielbrett, 100 Karten mit Fragen und Antworten,
     1 Würfel, 6 Wissensspeicher und 36 farbige Wissensecken
     600 Fragen rund um Borussia Mönchengladbach

Name: Victory at Sea: Merchant Convoy
Description:
Preventing attacks on defenceless merchant ships is the other main role of the navy, and it was her that the war was fought, day in and day out, by the humble corvette, frigate and destroyer escort, and later by escort carriers. Commerce raiding formed a critical part of the strategy for several nations – Germany’s Kriegsmarine almost brought Britain to her knees whilst the US Navy similarly strangled Japan’s movement of industrial goods, materials, troops and supplies.

Grouping ships into convoys meant there was more expanse of empty ocean out there – hopefully raiders would not even find the convoy. It also made escorts more effective, but in the event a convoy was hit by a surface raider, such as a heavy cruiser or battlecruiser, the target would be devastated in short order. Nevertheless, the convoy system helped a great deal. It would fall to the escorting ships to defend them until either a heavy covering force could come up in support or the merchants could make their escape. Some of the most heroic, and worst mismatched, actions of the war took place in defence of merchants convoys or troop ships.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Cutthroat Island Dueling Pirates
Description:
Bury your treasure or duel other pirates during your turn. Be sneaky and cunning just don't get caught or you'll pay the price! Cutthroat Island Dueling Pirates is a card plus dice game. The pirate that finds and holds on to the most treasure wins!

Each pirate is dealt 4 cards and given one 6 sided die. The remaining cards will are placed in the middle of the table to create the draw pile. Pirates have two choices during their turn. 1) they can bury treasure or 2) they can duel another pirate. Buried treasure comes in $1, $2, or $3 cards. When a pirate chooses to duel another pirate each pirate will roll their dice to see who is victorious. To the victor goes the spoils, one treasure card is randomly chosen from the losing pirate's treasure pile.

Your turn ends after you have played your card and be sure to draw back up to 4 cards. In addition to dueling and treasure cards, there are special cards that make the game even more fun and unpredictable.

How good of a pirate are you? Cheating is not only allowed but encouraged! Just don't get caught. Any pirate that catches another pirate cheating can take one treasure card from their pile. The game ends when the draw pile is gone, which signals the last round of play. The pirate with the most treasure wins that round and collects one gold coin. Play a quick 10 minute round or multiple rounds and see who is the best pirate!

-description from designer

Name: ポーション (Potion)
Description:
In potion, each player get cards with objectives on them. They will then try to fill a pot with the amount of leaves and cubes needed and take that pot when it's done.

There are two catches, though.
They need to take care of not overflowing the pot with ingredients or else, they will get no point for there objectives.
Also, they need to remember what other players put inside those pots which are not translucent.

Name: Tater Freighter
Description:
Will you be the master of the Tater Freighter? The baron of the Jam Tram? The captain of the Shrimp Blimp? Or will you skip out and just Tater Later?

In Tater Freighter, players try to outwit their opponents using their vehicles to swipe the most food. The person with the most food at the end of five rounds wins.

Players take turns simultaneously. Each Round:

     New food is revealed
     Players choose a vehicle secretly, planning and bluffing their opponents to claim the available food.
     Players reveal and resolve their vehicles. Food is claimed in ascending order. 
     Players collect claimed food. If multiple players choose the same vehicles the food splits. If it can't split, it remains for other players to claim.
     Once all claimed food is collected, the next round begins.


At the end of five rounds, players score their earned points for the sets of food you've collected. The player with the most food wins.

Tater Freighter is easy to learn. Remember this rules rhyme and you are ready to play:

     Place Eight Crates.
     Reveal a Vehicle.
     Lines Split Limes,
     Planes Split Grains,
     Blimps Split Shrimps,
     Trams Split Jams,
     Freighters Split Taters,
     Or Later Tater!
     Split or they sit.
     Fill bins to Win.


—description from the publisher

Name: Gloom: Knighted by a Noble Promo
Description:
Gloom Promo card for Noble Knight Games

Card text reads:

"You may play up to 2 additional cards this round."

Name: Dak To: Hill 875
Description:
November 19, 1967.
The second battalion of the 503rd Airborne Infantry, part of the famous 173rd ABN Brigade, attacked up a narrow ridge towards the top of hill 875.  The NVA had planned the battle for weeks...they were waiting.
330 Americans will face the entire 174th NVA regiment.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Reimraupe
Description:
Reimraupe is a German memo game with rhymes. 
Reimraupe ist ein Memospiel mit Reimen.

Name: Mini Memory Mischief
Description:
Meet Mikro and Chip, back in the 80s they were brand new and exciting to their tech nerd fans. Now they find themselves in a dusty old box, no one has use for their archaic technology but they will also never throw them away. 
 We can all take a lesson from Mikro and Chip who instead of letting their fate get them down have invented games to play together with their own memory stacks. Instead of worrying about the future they while away their hours playing games and entertaining each other, they’d love to play their favourite game with you, Memory Mischief.

Objective  Fill your stack with letters in alphabetical order. They do not have to be consecutive. Letters out of order will reduce your overall score at the end of the game.

Name: Malum Hortus
Description:
Malum Hortus is a cooperative game, all players win or lose together. Players are a party of Nymphs who have been lured in to this beautiful garden by day, only to find it turns evil at night and does not want you to leave. Do not let the word 'garden' fool you, this place is a vast woodland with shifting terrain and it will take many days to find your way to freedom.

The main aim of the game is to work together to ensure every Nymph leaves the board, escaping Malum Hortus. Along the way there are evil Flowers to avoid and Critters to save from the garden.

Magical creatures from many different realms find themselves ensnared by and lost in Malum Hortus; through Night Cards and Critter Cards you may encounter some of them along your journey, as well as being affected by the enchantments they use to try and flee. Be warned, not all of them are quite as kind natured as your fellow Nymphs, it is not just the Flowers of Malum Hortus that you need to fear.

—description from the designer

Name: Dice Forge: Dice Tower
Description:
Description: A brand new card for use with Dice Forge!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

Set-up (lock): Put the Dice Tower on Athena Island (2 and 3). To place this card on an island, place it straddling between cards so that it covers the portal of the island. To play, you only need one copy of the Dice Tower.

Effect: When the active player wants to complete an Heroic Feat on an island with the Dice Tower, he has to defeat the Dice Tower first. To do so, he places his Hero pawn on the Dice Tower Portal then rolls the dice like he was getting the divine blessings, except he has to pay the resources shown on his dice instead of winning these, all in order to defeat the Dice Tower (paying rules apply as for the Minotaur—See Dice Forge rules).

Name: Moonstone: The Cursed Troupe box
Description: This troupe box allows you to add three new heroes from Leshavult faction to the game: the Beast, the Revenant and young noble lady Anya Bartol in two variants (with and without Stryga).

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 1 – Gobiernos y Conflictos
Description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 1 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 2 – Economía y Sociedad
Description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 2 is a card game where Argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Description from the publisher (Spanish):

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 3 – Ciencia y Cultura
Description:
Sucesos Argentinos Vol. 3 is a card game where argentinian history knowledge is tested. Players must organize a chain of historical events chronologically ordered.

Each game can have from 2 to 4 players and lasts 15 to 20 minutes. It can be combined with other volumes to play up to 6 players.

This game box contains 75 unique double-sided cards depicting notable events in Argentina's history. On the front of each card are the name by which the historical event is known and an image, and on the back a description of the event and the year in which it occurred.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sucesos Argentinos es un juego de cartas donde se pone a prueba el conocimiento de historia argentina de los jugadores organizando una cadena de sucesos en orden cronológico.

Cada partida puede tener de 2 a 4 jugadores y tiene una duración de 15 a 20 minutos. Puede combinarse con otros volúmenes para permitir hasta 6 jugadores.

La caja del juego contiene 75 cartas únicas de doble cara que representan sucesos notables de la historia argentina. En el frente de cada carta encontramos el nombre por el cual se conoce al hecho histórico y una imagen orientativa, y al dorso una descripción del suceso y el año en que ocurrió.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Name: 2 Kings
Description:
2Kings is a competitive game for two people, with an average duration of 20 minutes. Players take on the role of two kings, the red king and the blue king, with the aim of conquering the opponent's kingdom by destroying his towers.

With this goal, the kings deploy and move their armies (represented by colored dice) on the battle field, trying to lead them to the opposing towers to hit them.

During the fighting, the kings will also use special spells to attack the opponent, upgrade their army or perform special moves.

2Kings box is a small diorama depicting a battlefield, complete with towers, rivers and meadows and was designed to be easily transportable in order to be able to easily play anywhere.

With a very quick setup (20 seconds) and short and quick game rules to memorize, 2 Kings is suitable for casual and non-casual players; the game has both elements of strategy and a random component given by the roll of the dice but well balanced thanks to the use of spells.

—description from the publisher

Name: Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks – River, Amy, Clara & Rory
Description:
"What matters is this, Doctor. Don't travel alone." —River Song

Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks is a semi co-operative boardgame where, with this expansion, you can now add more ways for the Doctor's companions to help the Doctor. Although you must be wary — the Daleks have their puppets and spies everywhere, so you may not always like the Friend you draw.

This Game Expansion adds 4 new Friend models, and the Friends deck to Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks, along with the new Friends game mechanic.
Families: Game: Doctor Who – Time of the Daleks

Name: Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks – Mickey, Rose, Martha & Donna
Description:
"Serious, there is an outrageous amount of running involved." —Donna Noble

Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks is a semi co-operative boardgame where with this expansion you can now add more ways for the Doctor’s companions to help the Doctor. Although you must be wary — the Daleks have their puppets and spies everywhere, so you may not always like the Friend you draw.

This Game Expansion adds 4 new Friend models, and the Friends deck to Doctor Who: Time of the Daleks, along with the new Friends game mechanic.
Families: Game: Doctor Who – Time of the Daleks

Name: Why You Lying!
Description:
Why You Lying! is a party game based on the classic Liar's Dice gameplay with some hilarious twists: legs and wings!

In this game, each player has a deck of 30 Animal cards consisting of 5 each of Cricket, Spider, Fish, Chicken, Rabbit,  and the almighty Mascot Worker! 
Players shuffle their deck and draw 5 hand cards at the beginning of each round. The start player will announce whether they will play with legs or wings in the current round by saying "I bet there are X (number of) Y (animals) with Z (amount of) legs (or wings) among all animals in all players' hand cards."
And players take turns to raise the bet by increasing X, Y (animals' hierarchy), or Z, OR they can call the previous player BLUFF!

Play smart with the information in your hand, and play cunning when you raise the bet. But beware, don't let the Mascot Workers fool you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: S.L.Benfica
Description:
With this edition, live the Monopoly experience by managing the famous Lisboner club. 
 Become the best manager of Sport Lisboa e Benfica. 
Travel through the most outstanding stadiums in the history of Sport Lisbon and Benfica: the best moments, the best players and the great victories that made us vibrate. 
Build new benches and stadiums, collect rents and spend your funds in the Official Store. 
Be astute and keep alert, because only one can win; for the rest, awaits bankruptcy. 
The Path to Success is marked by itself; Be the owner of everything! 
Who will be the winner?

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Cedar Falls: A Black Sun Operational Campaign
Description:
On January 8th, 1967 American lead forces jumped off on the largest American ground operation of the Vietnam War. It would last 20 days. The operation had been planned to remove the Viet Cong threat from an area north of Saigon known as the Iron Triangle. This area, only about 155 square km in size, was a major stronghold of the Viet Cong.

This 15 page PDF uses the BLACK SUN skirmish rules in a strictly historical operation led by US Army forces in the Iron Triangle area of Vietnam. It adds larger game play elements to the Black Sun universe. Provided are new Force Cards, New "What the...?!" Cards (ready to be printed and played with) and a three scenario campaign that can be enjoyed by multiple players.It also provides new rules including a Forward Observer and mortar team, starting fires and a Scenario Point objective system to determine the winner of a multi scenario campaign.

This Operational Campaign utilizes Platoon size units for game play and is designed for advanced Black Sun players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Operation Lift Off: A Black Sun Operational Campaign
Description:
This mini-campaign introduces one of the ways that the real world began to interact with the Black Sun event and allows the players to game out this early period of the Black Sun universe story. This mini-campaign will be set during the early period of the Vietnam War and the first scenario represents a secret operation by CIA agents supported by uniformed US ARMY troops and some local hired labour. The Viet Cong troops are indeed moving through the area and attack this target of opportunity.

Forces are then transported to the BLACK SUN event and all kinds of chaos ensues.

This Operational Campaign is intended for use by new players to the Black Sun universe and introduces background and story elements of horror to the players. This three scenario mini campaign includes new Force Cards for many different factions, new "What the...?!" Cards (ready to print and play) and some new advanced rules including veteran warriors. If you were part of the Black Sun Kickstarter you will have many of the troops needed for this game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Campaign Trail: Green Party Expansion
Description:
This edition of the Green Party Expansion contains voter tokens compatible with the original Campaign Trail base game from Cosmic Wombat Games. It also includes Timed Releases and a larger box and tray designed to contain both the base game and the Green Party Expansion.

Campaign Trail is a highly reviewed, card-driven strategy game of electoral politics where players compete to win their candidate the presidency.

The Green Party Expansion adds more action cards, more candidates, new global events, and end game goals that introduce new strategies and allows more players to compete for the White House!

Now playable with up to 4 parties and up to 8 players, the Green Party Expansion allows you to challenge more of your rivals for political victory.

-description from publisher

Name: Dragon's Gate
Description:
The goal of Dragon's Gate is to be the first player to get one of your own Dragons across the board and through the enemy’s gate. (The corner spaces marked with Chinese characters are nominally the posts of the gate.)

A Dragon moves forward by taking a single step, either diagonally or vertically, onto an empty space. A Dragon may also fly (jump) forward over a single friendly Dragon to the empty space just beyond. But it may not fly over an enemy Dragon.

A Dragon captures enemy pieces by withdrawal. This means if a Dragon begins its turn with an enemy Dragon adjacent and just in front of it, it may take a single step backwards, in the opposite direction, to the empty space just behind it.(Imagine a Dragon rearing its head back to breathe fire.) The enemy Dragon is then removed from the board.

In a typical game of breakthrough/attainment there are usually two basic elements: 1. - The player is trying to advance his own pieces across the board. 2. – The player attacks his opponent’s pieces to prevent him from doing the same. Backwards captures is a mechanic that affects both of these simultaneously. You can remove one of your opponent’s pieces only at the cost of delaying your own advancement.

-description from designer

Name: Misja Kampinos
Description:
Misja Kampinos is an easy boardgame published for LGD Kampinos (Between Vistula and Kampinos association). It was distributed for free on autumn 2019 during series of local events.

Players blaze trails through Kampinos forest, visit important places, seek for the wild areas and observe animals. During the game, they learn about local nature, history, monuments and important places (NGO's, parks, sport areas). After the game they analyse their trails and can decide to follow this trails in real-life walk tours.

The game consists of draft, set collection and push-your-luck mechanisms. It's simple and fast, so you can play it either with your family or friends.

Every card shows different real place in Kampinos, that is worth visiting. Every card encourages players to visit the forest.

Game was originally printed only in Polish, but you can play it even if only one of players knows the language.

—description from the designer

Name: Upset Kakumei
Description:
The climbing game Upset Kakumei, a derivative of daifugo, allows you switch the strength of cards.

At the start of a round, each player is dealt ten cards, each of which has two values. Cards may be played in sets of X-of-a-kind of increasing value (with X=1,2,3), or a é©å‘½ — "kakumei" or revolution — card can be played to reverse the value of numbers; otherwise, a player may pass. The game ends when someone has played all of their cards. Alternatively, you can play multiple rounds and score players based on when they exit a round.

Name: トゥルーマリンショー (True Marine Show)
Description:
Summon iconic characters from Azur Lane, Touhou Project, and hololive as powerful sailors to collect the most Vtuber Points (VP) in this quick, portable deckbuilding game.

Play sailors from your hand to gain VP in order to purchase more powerful sailors from the market and improve your deck. The game ends at the end of the round when a player reaches 20 or more VP. Whoever has the most VP is the winner.
Families: Video Game Theme: Project Shrine Maiden

Name: For King and Parliament: The Battle of Roundway Down
Description:
The TtS! Battle of Roundway Down scenario is a digital download, designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules, but useful with other rule systems too. 
It will suit two to four players. It's a most unusual battle, with the Royalist army consisting almost entirely of horse, heavily outnumbered and attacking uphill. And winning!

The 12 page PDF includes a brief account of the campaign and a reconstruction of the battle. It contains orders of battle for both sides, two alternative deployment diagrams and several images of beautifully painted wargames figures. It can be viewed on a tablet or printed out and bound.

—description from the publisher

Name: 타케노코: 빅 박스 (Takenoko Big Box)
Description:
A long time ago at the Japanese Imperial court, the Chinese Emperor offered a giant panda bear as a symbol of peace to the Japanese Emperor. Since then, the Japanese Emperor has entrusted his court members (the players) with the difficult task of caring for the animal by tending to his bamboo garden.

In Takenoko, the players will cultivate land plots, irrigate them, and grow one of the three species of bamboo (Green, Yellow, and Pink) with the help of the Imperial gardener to maintain this bamboo garden. They will have to bear with the immoderate hunger of this sacred animal for the juicy and tender bamboo. The player who manages his land plots best, growing the most bamboo while feeding the delicate appetite of the panda, will win the game.

This Big Box edition also contains Takenoko: Chibis expansion.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Fairy's Smoothie (フェアリーズ・スムージー)
Description:
Fairy smoothie is a game from Japan.
Players are fairies working on a farm.  They work hard to make delicious crop.  But fairies love smoothies and mischief. Sneak around and steal the crops while playing tricks on the other fairies to create the best smoothies possible!

If there are less than two places to move, the game ends.
After the tokens are scored and the final bonus is added, the person with the highest score is the winner.

On a turn:
1. The parent player places a supervisor card face down in the center.
2. Children move their squares 1 or 2 at a time in a clockwise direction.
3. The parent reveals the Surveillance Spot card and takes one token from the child in the square with the card.
4. The child players who were not robbed get the adjacent tokens in turn, and the card's effect is applied.

Name: Lee at Antietam
Description:
Lee at Antietam is a small wargame on the battle that occurred near Sharpsburg on 17 September 1862. 
This game is intended to serve as an introduction to history gaming for younger players while advanced and optional rules provide an enjoyable game for experienced players.

Those who have played our other Civil War games such as Lee at Gettysburg will find many new concepts introduced, making Lee at Antietam closer to the complexity of a 'low complexity' wargame.

Advanced and optional rules based on historical events are included for more experienced players looking for a deeper and more complicated game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Agincourt
Description:
Agincourt is a simple game designed for the novice wargamer that allows you and a friend to control the opposing armies involved in the battle to see if you can change history.

While the game is aimed at the introductory level player it includes more complex rules such as ranged combat and blocking terrain effects.

The English victory in the 1415 battle of Agincourt crippled the French army and the nobility at its foundation. Unfortunately for English King Henry V, his son did not capitalise on the victory he bought with so much blood. Both these factors played a big part in extending the ‘hundred years war’ for another 4 decades.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Emperor Strikes Back
Description:
The Emperor Strikes Back is a simple wargame simulation of the Battle of Waterloo in 1815 that finally ended Napoleon's dream of French dominance.

One player controls the French Grand Armee and the other player controls Wellingtons British army, reinforced by the Prussians. It is intended as the ideal introductory game for people new to strategy games with an interest in the era.

Several optional rules are included for more experienced young gamers such as those who have played our other games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: #URNT
Description:
Two monuments, both alike in dignity, in the fair Parthenon where we lay our scene ...

From Ancient Greek break into mutiny…

“Spartan strength is the only way to "URN" the victory!”

Ares’ gravelly voice and stone-cold stare were enough to make anyone tremble. Except for Apollo... who glared back, unwavering.

“Athenian abilities are far better. Brains beat brawn in the end.”

Fortunately, you know that a powerful society consists instead of a balance between sword and wits… between strength and ability... between Spartans and Athenians...

URNT is a simple deck-building game for 2 players of any age. Players begin with six basic Spartans and draft a few other cards and resources to build their starting deck.

On your turn:

1. Collect your wages. You'll receive 5 coins at the beginning of each turn. (If you have hired perpetual BANKERS, you may collect even more coins every turn.)

2. Spend coins to hire Spartans and Athenians to improve your deck. Recruit perpetuals to gain advantages for every turn.

3. Challenge your rival(s) in the AGORA by playing 4 or 5 cards. Your rival(s) must respond to each card you play. Whichever player wins the majority will get one Victory Point.

4. Finally, each player discards the cards that they played into their own personal discard pile and replenishes their hand back up to 5 cards. (If you have hired a perpetual FISHERMAN, you may draw extra cards each time they draw.)

Play continues clockwise until there are no more VP in the supply.

The game comes with the MONUMENTAL expansion. This is a small expansion that adds a new currency- URNS! Spend URNS to construct monuments that trigger powerful actions and multiply your end-game points.

-description from publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: Admiral Graf Spee & Admiral Scheer
Description:
The Deutschland-class of warships were relatively small, by battleship standards, but were well armoured and carried the type of armament traditionally seen only on battleships. This led to them being nicknamed ‘pocket battleships’. 
Superb commerce raiders, the Admiral Scheer successfully plied the Atlantic and Indian Oceans, disrupting merchant shipping wherever it went, whilst the Admiral Graf Spee was famously cornered during the Battle of the River Plate and scuttled herself soon after.

Contents:
2 Model Ships
  â€£ 1 Admiral Graf Spee
  â€£ 1 Admiral Scheer
2 Deutschland-class Ship Cards
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Missouri
Description:
Only the mighty Yamato displaced more than the massive, yet very fast, Iowa-class battleships. 
The last battleship to be commissioned by the USA, USS Missouri known as the ‘Mighty Mo’ acted as venue for the Japanese surrender in WWII. 
Iowa-class ships saw service far beyond the Second World War and were upgraded with modern electronics, weapons systems and cruise missiles – USS Missouri was finally decommissioned in 1992 after a distinguished career.

Contents:
1 Model Ship
  â€£ USS Missouri
1 Ship Card
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher

Name: BelloLudi: Strategy Game
Description:
Welcome to the strategy game by BelloLudi! Nice that you have taken an interest in wargaming. These rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games. BelloLudi designed these rules especially for teambuilding purposes. During our sessions we received feedback that people liked our game, but it was initially too complicated. Now, we have a ruleset of eleven pages, no more than the game of RISK. From page thirteen on, we included some extra rules. You will not be needing them at first, but we can imagine that you would like some variations as your experience grows. Start with that page when you have some battles under your belt.

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players. The same goes for the number of miniatures involved. We have collected huge armies over the years but, as you are new to the game, you’ll probably do not. Do not fear! The army structure that is presented in this writing, can be easily adapted to the number of miniatures that you have available. Albeit that a large army look suitably impressive. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies.

This rules-set simulates battles in the period of 1700 to 1900, the age which historians call the long 19th century. Units were drawn up in line in order to maximise the effect of their weaponry. The musket, the type of gun that the troops were supplied with, was only accurate on short distances. During a volley all muskets were fired simultaneously at the same target. Off course, this required iron discipline of the men. Soldiers of that age were drilled to fight formed up into line formation and to march in columns. During the game, your troops will do likewise.

In an ideal scenario the enemy was pinned in place by fire of artillery, the threat of cavalry or the fire of infantry. Once the enemy was pinned, other units could deliver the coup de grace. Tactics were therefore based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades, or even armies. Every unit would have its own specific task and if they executed their tasks in unison, success was often achieved. The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage, indicated by chips, that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry charges and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades and as such, the whole army.

Your role will be that of a brigadier in a nineteenth century army. Should more players be available, one of you will play the part of Commander-in Chief or general. Should any disagreement arise concerning the rules, we suggest you roll a dice. The one who rolls the highest number has it right, for now.

—description from publisher

Name: Censored: The Hilarious Explanation Game
Description:
This laugh out loud game asks players to describe words to their team without mentioning forbidden words.  The number of forbidden words increases each round, making the game more and more challenging!

If you mention a forbidden word you must wear a censored mouthpiece for the rest of the game!

Complete the most challenges without mentioning forbidden words to win the game!

Name: Fiesta de los Muertos: La Catrina
Description:
1 box: 3 expansions!
La Catrina contains 3 expansions for Fiesta de los Muertos (each of those requiring the base game). 
The first one, La Catrina, introduces a "Campaign mode" in which you'll try to colorize the flowers on La Catrina's hat, worn by "the Dame of Death". Cooperation is more important than ever!
The second one, The Processions, adds 84 new names, divided in 6 themes. Each round, pick 2 categories at random and play with these 2 only.
The third one, The Dead are back, adds 70 names to the base game and 6 new restrictions.

Name: Covid
Description:
Covid is a funny, strategic card game about our struggle to self-isolate. It's a game everyone should have at home as a laughable reminder of the craziness that went on in the Covid era.

There are two ways to win, either become immune by collecting Vaccine tokens or eliminate other players by giving Infection tokens.

There are 108 cards containing stories and pictures of the strange things that people have done during the pandemic.

On your turn, you read your card aloud, choose who you will play it on and assign the token(s) in accordance to what the card instructs.

Infection cards usually have stories of the unbelievable and sometimes stupid things people have done, like cutting holes in masks to breathe better, or suggesting we inject disinfectant to control the spread. They are played on other players to give Infection tokens.

Vaccine cards have stories of the more heroic or mundane things that we have had to do, but have all done them anyway, like having a wine tour in your house or doing YouTube workouts to curb the iso-snacks. They are played on yourself to gain Vaccine tokens.

Strategic cards are used to block Infections by wearing a mask or social distancing, or they can be used to create havoc by forcing opponents to only use specific cards.

Then there is Bat Soup, the card that started it all. Bat Soup gives an Infection that keeps spreading each round until someone, anyone removes it with a Vaccine card.

The required amount of tokens to eliminate a player with Infection tokens or win outright with Vaccine tokens is always equal to the amount of active players.

Five players requires five tokens, four = four, etc. If a player is eliminated the required tokens is now one less. This can result in a domino effect and remove all your opponents at once or even accidentally take yourself out!

-description from designer

Name: War of the Worlds: The New Wave – Kickstarter Edtion
Description:
This is an exclusive edition available only directly from Grey Fox Games that contains 4 Promo cards, 30 custom Civilian meeples, 25 highly detailed miniatures, in addition to the content normally available in the Retail edition. This edition also includes the Irish Sea expansion.

Exclusive promo cards included: Spyder, Orbital Strike and Draw Energy for the Aliens, and Dog Scout, Bombardment and Tesla for the Humans.

The Kickstarter edition has a different UPC code than the retail edition.
Families: Books: The War of the Worlds

Name: C'est bon à savoir! Le grand jeu de la Culture Générale
Description:
Be the first one on the finish line by answering general culture questions (science, history, geography,arts...) and taking on challenges (sing, mimic, draw...)

C'est bon à savoir! Un jeu familial,
1 400 questions et défis de culture générale par le détour malicieux de la littérature !

Name: Best 11 Board Game: Roma
Description:
Best 11 Board Game: Roma football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: Roma
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.
Families: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni

Name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Deliriant Promo Card
Description:
Available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Shuffle the card with the game equipment cards.

When used:
Choose a player to shuffle all their integrity cards and place them face-down without looking at any of them. They may not view their face-down integrity cards for the rest of the game.

Also included in the 2024 Equipment Pack 1 as part of Good Cop Bad Cop 4th edition kickstarter.

Name: Monopoly: Roma
Description:
The most famous family board game in the world, offers you another exciting edition of Monopoly - AS Roma
     Choose your lucky marker, land on your favorite boxes, build fortunes, but watch out for tax boxes, jail time and avoid bankruptcy
     Monopoly ranks the formations that have made the history of Rome
     If ready to build the stadium for your favorite formation and win the game
     The fast and fun trading game for the whole family




     Il piu' famoso gioco da tavolo per famiglie del mondo, ti offre un'altra entusiasmante edizione di Monopoly - AS Roma
     Scegli il tuo segnalino fortunato, arriva sulle tue caselle preferite, accumula fortune, ma fai attenzione alle caselle delle tasse, al carcere ed evita fallimento
     Monopoly schiera le formazioni che hanno fatto la storia della roma
     Se pronto a costruire lo stadio per la tua formazione preferita e vincere la partita
     Il gioco di compravendita veloce e divertente per tutta la famiglia

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Roma – Bite Size
Description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit. 
600 questions about the world of AS Roma. 
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty! 
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box. 
Test your knowledge of the following topics: 

     Coaches,
     League,
     Curiosities,
     Players,
     International Matches,
     Victories.

Name: Hindsight 2020
Description:
Hindsight 2020 is the game of the year. Check the news, enact policies, protect your citizens, and sabotage rivals to be the last nation standing!

In Hindsight 2020, 2-6 players will start with a population of 10 million (10 tokens), and take turns flipping cards from the deck and playing cards from their hand that cause themselves and/or opponents to gain or lose population, with the goal of eliminating all others or having the most population by the end of the deck.

While Event cards cause players to gain or lose population, Policy cards contain stats that modify the amount each player is affected. Bonus cards allow players to perform special actions, and to combo actions. The Hindsight card retroactively protects a player from any event!

-description from publisher

Name: Indian Mutine-era: A Supplement for "Taiping Era"
Description:
Indian Mutine-era is a supplement for Taiping Era which enables those rules to be used for fighting battles on the tabletop from the 1857/8 revolt in India.

It is not a complete set of rules, and requires Taiping Era in order to play.

The supplement contains rule amendments, a set of linked scenarios and a QRS.

—Description from publisher

Name: Blood Red Skies: Lockheed F-80C Shooting Star Squadron
Description:
A single seat fighter-bomber, the Lockheed F-80C was a later production version of the P-80, the original designation denoting pursuit. However, with changes to the American system of designation in 1947, the Shooting Star would be re-designated as a ‘F’, a fighter. The Shooting Star was designed in fewer than 6 months around the British Halford H.1 (Goblin) engine and first flew in 1944, with P-80s flying under combat conditions in Italy the next year.

By the time of the Korean war, the aircraft was considered somewhat obsolete, but was at the forefront of the initial sorties across ‘MiG Alley’, of which 1500 flights were made in the first four months alone. It was on November 8th 1950 that a Shooting Star claimed the first MiG-15 shot down, in one of first ever instances of jet-to-jet combat.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Korean War

Name: Puzzle Board Chess
Description:
The standard chess board has been broken up into 16 tiles (plus 1 extra) of four squares each. Now, a big part of the strategy is how to lay your tiles and deploy your pieces to best achieve checkmate.

The puzzle tiles create chasms and gaps that change the dynamic of chess. Each player gets 8 puzzle board tiles. An extra neutral piece is placed on the table first.

The players randomly choose who goes first and take turns adding their puzzle tiles to the game board. If necessary, place one of your chess pieces on your tiles to avoid confusion about who placed which tile. After the board is completed and all tiles connect, arrange your chess pieces on your tiles where you think they work best for your strategy and the landscape of the battlefield. Whoever placed the first tile is the first to move a piece to begin a game.

Pieces move as they do in a standard game, EXCEPT:

     There are no PAWNS. They don’t work on this kind of board.
     Since KNIGHTS can jump, that means they can jump over gaps in the board. But they must still move in the classic “L” shape and be able to land on a physical square.
     Even for tiles that don’t connect by tabs, if their corners adjoin, BISHOPS may be able to cross from one piece to the next.


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Red Skies: Grumman F9F Panther Squadron
Description:
The F9F Panther was Grumman’s first production jet fighter, used extensively during the Korean War. It proved one of the United States Navy’s first successful carrier-born jet fighters and was the first jet fighter to be used by the Blue Angels aerobatics display team.

The F9F would remain the primary US Navy and USMC jet fighter and ground-attack aircraft of the Korean War, flying around 78,000 sorties in total. The Panther claimed the first US Navy aerial victory of the war claiming a prop-powered Yak-9 in July 1950.

In one little-known instance, a single Panther shot down four Mig-15s in a single 35 minute period, a unique feat for pilot Lt Royce Williams. This is in spite of the Panther’s relatively poor speed when compared to the nimble MiGs.

Other notable pilots of Panthers in Korea include first man on the moon, Neil Armstrong (who in fact bailed out during a combat mission when his aircraft was brought down by wire strung out across a valley), as well as fellow astronaut John Glenn and baseball star Ted Williams.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Blood Red Skies – Korean War

Name: Shi
Description:
In Japanese, the word “Shi” can mean, depending on the context, either “the number four” or “death.” That is why in Japan 4 is considered an unlucky number in much the same way 13 is in the West.

Object: A player loses if reduced to 4 pieces.

Samurais vs. Ninjas. Samurais go first.

Pieces slide like a Chess Queen. There are 8 pieces per side, set up on the players first row.

Jump Attack: Captures of enemies can only be made by jumping over a single, friendly piece along the path of attack. Any number of unoccupied spaces, including none, may exist between the attacking piece, the piece being jumped, and the piece to be captured. This is much like the attack of the Cannon piece in Chinese Chess. Except here the intervening “screen” must be a friendly piece and never an enemy.

—description from the designer

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Generator v2.0
Description:
LnLT Battle Generator system allowing you to generate your own battles.  What we’ve done is to add features that offer some generic systems for building your own battles. This allows players to mix and match forces from different games and even different eras. Players can have the Viet Cong forces from Heroes of the Nam face off against the German forces from Heroes of Normandy.

We now provide two ways for this, the first is our Generic Unit Point System we’ve designed, which can be applied to all games in the series. The second is our Pre-defined Unit Cost Charts. We have also kept the Pre-defined unit cost charts included in the previous Battle Generator. Players can use either the newer Generic Unit Point System or our Pre-defined Point Base Unit Costs. Moving forward, newly released games will include the Pre-defined Point Base Unit Cost Charts with the module rules. The amount of points is defined by the forces in the battle you want to play and then modified up or down by the variables of the battle. This means that you get to the action fast but allow the battle to be very flexible.

This Battle Generator has been tailored to work with all Lock ‘n Load Tactical modules in the series past, present, and future. Players can mutually agree on one or all Battle Generator features they want to use, the choice is all yours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Quizz Toulouse
Description:
Quizz Toulouse: 106 cards, 530 questions to learn everything about the pink city!

For each question, 5 clues, increasingly easy. 
The fewer clues the player uses to answer, the more points he will earn.

Whoever wins the most points at the end of the game will be chosen the best Toulousain in the group!


Quizz Toulouse: 106 cartes, 530 questions pour tout savoir sur la ville rose !

Pour chaque question, 5 indices, de plus en plus faciles. M
oins le joueur utilisera d'indices pour répondre, plus il gagnera de points.

Celui qui gagnera le plus de points à la fin de la partie sera désigné le meilleur Toulousain du groupe !

Name: Stadium: A Sport Odyssey
Description:
“Citizens of the United Regions, sons and daughters of this broken world, it has saved us all from extinction. We gather within its walls tonight for one thing and one thing only. To play the game it has given us. Play bravely young champions towards the finals and towards the ultimate prize known to man………life!”  The roar of the crowd erupts as the holographic Commissioner H.R. Cloverfield fades away.

It is the year 2067. Mankind has regrouped after “Gods departure,” a series of natural disasters that devastated the world over two decades ago. The surviving populations are now divided by regions governed by various companies and ideas on how to reshape the future. Despite the isolation between societies, they all covet the same source of power. Etherium, also known as “E-cellz” is the highly efficient energy source of today. This power along with advanced formulas is only generated in the grand vessel amongst the clouds known as the Stadium.

Stadium: A Sport Odyssey (or SASO) is a competitive two player collectible card-board game based loosely on the rules of good old American football. You and your opponent take on the role of Head Coaches hired by a company to take command of their team in the ongoing contest held in the Stadium. By playing with pre-constructed or your own customized team deck of cards, Coaches go head to head playing cards in phase turns. In the last phase the stats of the revealed cards played are tallied and determine the success of the play.

The goal is simple; out think, outlast and outscore your opponent before time runs out. Calling the right plays, managing your players and spending momentum wisely are but a few of your tasks for victory. The real challenge is taking control and maintaining the Stadium’s ever-changing environment. Whoever masters this…. masters the game and future of the world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Xmas PileUP
Description:
A pocket-sized, Christmas-themed, stacking-dexterity game for the whole family. Featuring cute Christmas tree shaped meeples!

Players take it in turns to roll a dice and stack Christmas trees into piles, with a twist.
Each turn, you may decide to either add trees to your own pile, or force a friend to add the trees to their's.
If your pile topples you must start again and the player with the tallest pile wins.

Simple, yet effective, Xmas PileUP

—description from the publisher

Name: Codenames: Bonuskaarten 2019
Description: A set of 10 extra cards with (regular) Dutch words for the Dutch version of Codenames.

Name: Codenames: Bonuskaarten 2020
Description: A set of 10 extra cards with (regular) Dutch words for the Dutch version of Codenames.

Name: Monster Park
Description:
The king wants an animal park of unprecedented diversity, filled with spectacular mythical creatures. He asks several magicians to go on the hunt for suitable creatures in the steppe and forests, mountains and seas of his empire.

Monsterpark is a simple, fast paced card game. Each player slips into the role of a magician and tries to capture as many mythical creatures as possible that are popular with the people and desired by their ruler until the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Errichte einen phantastischen Zoo voller unglaublicher Fabelwesen!

Der König möchte einen Tierpark von nie dagewesener Vielfalt, gefüllt mit spektakulären Fabelwesen. Gleich mehrere Zauberer bittet er, in Steppe und Wäldern, Bergen und Meeren seines Reiches auf die Jagd nach geeigneten Kreaturen zu gehen.

Monsterpark ist ein einfaches, schnelles Kartenspiel. Jeder Spieler schlüpft in die Rolle eines Zauberers und versucht, bis zum Ende des Spiels möglichst viele beim Volk beliebte und von seinem Herrscher gewünschte Fabelwesen einzufangen.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mount Topia
Description:
Moun Topia is strategic card game that takes place in the dangerous mountain range in the Kingdom of Doomtopia in the shadow of the parallell universe of Earth.

The mountain is known for huge deposits of unique and valuable minerals, and therefore mining is the work of power. Mount Topia is by far the richest mountain area, containing treasures like diamonds, sapphire, gold and rare gemstones.

For decades different Clans from all parts of Doomtopia have fought to conquer the mountains and take control over the resources, battling it out to conquer the 5 Mine fields in the Northern area of Mount Topia.

Place the 36 Mine field cards in a 6x6 system on the table with the Mine Signs facing up. Mine field name and description is on the back side of these cards, and hidden at the start point.
There are two different types of “Mine signs“ cards that matches - so there are 18 of each version.

You pick one Mine sign card and then choose a matching card either vertical, horisontal or diagonal.
This becomes your mining route. When you turn these two cards, you will find the mining field information that you need for deciding which clan workers you shall choose to get the best team to extract and collect the most treasures on this mining route.

The clan that collects the most treasures from the Mine fields has won the game.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – The Haunting of Dale
Description:
Digital Only Content, added as DLC in the App on various platforms.

“Then the people of Harrowdale shut fast their doors and shroud their windows and are afraid. But the Dead come seldom forth and only at times of great unquiet and coming death.”
   –J.R.R. Tolkien, The Return of the King

The road of your journey has led you this time to the Kingdom of Dale. A shadow has risen over this great realm of Men, and now King Bain must call upon heroes in order to investigate disturbing rumors and restore peace to his kingdom. It is once again time for a new adventure.

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce two new products for The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth:

The Haunting of Dale downloadable campaign
Haunting of Dale is the second downloadable campaign available for purchase through the Journeys in Middle-earth companion app, offering a completely new set of quests and challenges that require both the Core Set and the new Shadowed Paths expansion to play. With thirteen new adventures and a branching storyline full of mystery and intrigue in and around the Kingdom of Dale, the trials presented by this campaign are sure to thrill even the most experienced Fellowship.

The party has been summoned by King Bain, son of Bard the Bowman and current ruler of Dale. Concerning rumors have emerged of a dangerous shade stalking the land, cattle have been vanishing or turning up dead, and tensions are rising with the neighboring Dwarves in Erebor. At the behest of King Bain, you must convince the council of Dale that you are capable of investigating these rumors and—hopefully—able to combat the shade as well. However, time is of the essence, and there are more rumors than you will have the opportunity to chase.

In Haunting of Dale, players will learn of multiple rumors regarding the shade and other events surrounding the region of Dale. They will need to decide which rumors to pursue, knowing that they cannot pursue all of them in a single playthrough. Depending on which leads they follow, the players will explore not only Dale and its surrounding farms and wilderness, but also the neighboring Erebor, where the party can seek the shade while gaining the friendship of the Longbeard Dwarves. These multiple branching paths make every playthrough of the Haunting of Dale campaign unique, allowing players to return to Dale again and again for plenty of thrilling adventures.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Zig
Description:
Zig is a game of cards and cubes for three to five players in which each player is attempting to acquire sets of colored cubes to score points. The card play is unique in that a pair of "Zag" cards is played to a mat in such a way that a connection is made between verbs, numbers, and colors. These combinations result in the exchange of cubes, and aside from a point value, these cubes can be used to purchase additional cards, thereby forming new connections in the next round. Can you utilize the available "Zigs and Zags" effectively to gain more points than your opponents? You have only nine turns to find out!

—description from the publisher
